abstract.p: Julian Hampden, off-duty police officer with Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, is shot in back in Queens near Flushing Meadow Park; he is listed in serious but stable condition (S)

block.p: An off-duty police officer with the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was shot in the back last night in Queens near Flushing Meadow Park, the agency said.
The officer, Julian Hampden, 39, was in serious but stable condition at Elmhurst Hospital Center.
An off-duty police officer with the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was shot in the back last night in Queens near Flushing Meadow Park, the agency said.
The officer, Julian Hampden, 39, was in serious but stable condition at Elmhurst Hospital Center.

Officer Hampden, a seven-year veteran stationed at La Guardia Airport, was walking back to his car with a woman on Jewel Avenue near the park around 11 p.m. when he was shot, said Steve Coleman, a Port Authority spokesman. Officer Hampden got in his car, drove off and flagged down a New York City police officer, Mr. Coleman said. The police have no suspects or motive for the shooting, said Detective Edward Reuss, a police spokesman.
